5 Challenges We Encountered When Creating AI Voices

Voicemod
·

Follow

5 min read
·
Sep 15, 2022

--

The release of Voicemod’s new real-time voices powered by artificial intelligence has revolutionized the way our users explore their audio expression. Our AI voices empower users to transform their voices to sound like who they want when they want. And for our partners and other third-party applications, hardware, and software, this easily integrated technology allows them to be the trusted brand that enables positive online social experiences.

How We Brought AI to Voice Modulation

The creation of our AI voices was a culmination of technology and creativity, science and art. We worked with professional voice actors whose vocal characteristics matched the specific voice we wanted to recreate. We provided scripts that they read from as we recorded them to capture specific combinations of sounds and words that we would then use to feed our AI models. The importance of data can’t be understated in this project. The more data we collected and fed to the model, the more accurate the final results were.

It took us about six months of development work and iterations to start seeing actual results. While there are some companies that train AI models to transform one person’s voice (a “one-to-one” model), we wanted to build a “many-to-one” model. In other words, we wanted our AI model to transform many voices into one voice. And the final step was the “any-to-any” model.

The creation of our AI voices proved to be a success. But as with all new technology, there were definitely some obstacles we encountered along the way. Here are some of the main challenges we faced when building our AI voices:

Challenge 1: Keeping spirits high

Working with artificial intelligence to create these voices is like working with a puzzle. From a technological side, it’s not complex. The real challenge was the actual management of the process.

The team was constantly iterating on these “new puzzles.” It was a recursive process that became very stressful for developers and the stakeholders involved because we never quite knew what the result would be. In fact, most of the time, the results were failures. Let’s put it this way: The AI voices we currently have run on two models. And to get those two, we had to create about one thousand models.

After a while, it’s only natural that a team would start to lose motivation and become discouraged. The key to remember here is that these iterations are essential when designing AI voices because anything in development calls for a great deal of precision. But nevertheless, keeping the team’s motivation and spirits high was one of the most stressful and difficult aspects of creating our AI voices.

Challenge 2: Technological capabilities

The other challenge was regarding the actual technological capabilities and capacity that these voices demanded. When we decided that this project was possible and something we were going to move forward with, we encountered two problems.

First was the latency, the amount of time it takes from input to output. The fact that our voices operate in real-time made this all the more challenging. And second, the model capacity–how heavy the voices are on computation and the level of restrictions. We had to reduce almost everything and transform some algorithms that are intended to be much bigger.

Challenge 3: Training the models

Training and conditioning the models was the central spot of the development and research process. We used several methods to train the models. One was telling the model to take an input (a voice) and convert that one voice into two different voices so that it went from the same input to two different outputs. In this case, we were telling the model to recognize that these two inputs are the same in content.

Another training trick was to convert Voice A to Voice B and then Voice B to Voice A, and finally, to be sure that the original voice A was equivalent to the final Voice A. In other words, the voice transformed twice had to be the same. Again, this process resulted in roughly one thousand models, out of which came the two that our voices operate on today.

Challenge 4: Evaluating the models

The other challenge we encountered was evaluating the quality of the voices and selecting one model over another. This was a very complex process and required a great deal of effort. We approached this by calculating a set of 5 to 10 parameters in a variety of audios, including factors like male, female, age, and audio conditions. We then selected the optimal algorithm in terms of intelligibility, naturalness, identity, and artifacts.

This was a demanding process because the audio parameters were not very consistent, nor did they have great variability, and could therefore generate inaccurate results.

Challenge 5: Navigating the dark side of AI

With great power comes great responsibility. There is definitely a “dark side” to this powerful technology related to privacy, impersonation, fraud, and more. However, it’s important to understand that there is no stopping this technology from coming to fruition. It’s going to happen–it is happening–so it’s just a matter of how companies plan to deal with safety and security.

At Voicemod, for example, we’ve developed watermarking technology to track the usage of our AI voices. As we continue to develop this technology and make our AI voices more sophisticated, we are also committed to treating security and ethics with the utmost importance.

The Future of Our AI Voice Technology

This is not a one-and-done project. Our journey to AI voice modulation has only just begun. Our main objective moving forward is to continuously improve our voices to be as natural as possible. Naturalness is a big challenge because while the voices may be natural in some situations, that may not be the case when you use them in, for example, a noisy environment. Another objective is to improve the expressibility of our AI voices–feeling angry, happy, or sad. It’s very difficult to transmit feelings and emotions into AI voices. And then, of course, there are the technical requirements that we must always consider, like latency and low CPU.

To put it simply, this is an ongoing mission that we at Voicemod are committed to and excited about to help change the audio expression and sonic identity landscape for key players in this space.

If you’re interested in learning more about our AI technology and how you can implement it into your product, please contact us at bizdev@voicemod.net.
